intro: Conophytum maughanii subsp. latum, commonly known as the broad-leaved conophytum, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun exposure, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and succulent collections. Its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make it an attractive addition to dry landscapes.
